children.value: Use the pagination component to apply button styles to a connected set of links that go to related pages (for example, previous, next, or page numbers).
You can make a very simple pagination container with just the Previous and Next buttons. Add the class
button if there isn't a preceding page, or to the
button if there isn't a succeeding page.
Previous Next
For pagination across multiple pages, make sure it's clear to the user where they are in a set of pages.
To do this, add anchor links to the
element. Previous and Next buttons should always be present. Add the class
to the Previous button if you're on the first page. Apply the class
As always, make sure to include the appropriate
attributes to make the element accessible.
Previous 1 2 3 … 8 9 10 Next
